title: [K-12] Applied Mathematics Learning Through the H-Infinity Optimal Control Project

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory linear algebra, basic calculus concepts, and foundational control theory knowledge
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment designed for pre-service teachers to apply mathematical optimization concepts to real educational settings. Collaboration using personal devices and integration of online tools

learning_goals: Explain the fundamental principles of H-infinity optimal control problems and represent them with mathematical models
Implement game theory-based optimization strategies using adaptive critic methods through simulations
Understand the concept of GARE (Game Algebraic Riccati Equation) and possess the ability to design algorithms for solving simple problems
Explain the application of H-infinity control theory to real-world cases (e.g., aircraft autopilot systems) through team-based projects

resources: H-Infinity Control Theory Textbooks and Video Materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
